RELAY FOR LIFE

Relay for life is an organization under the American Cancer society designed to create ways for communities to get involved in cancer research. Organized events are a way to honor survivors, remember lost loved ones, and raise funds to support treatment research. Donations to the program support patients and survivors who need financial aid.

Events sponsored by Relay for Life organize participants into teams that have members take turns running around the track. The entire event can be up to twenty-four hours long, and one member per team is expected to be running at all times. The relay for life movement raises over four hundred million dollars per year from contributions and donations. The funds you raise all help benefit people in need.

  • ABOUT US

    Survivors of cancer are all invited to relay for life events to become involved and share your story. Relay for life can introduce you to other survivors and patients that face the same challenges and provide knowledge and friendship. All survivors can walk the opening lap alongside their caregivers. Survivor caregivers are welcome and honored for their support, and have to opportunity to join the local Relay for Life planning committee.
    Read a Survivor's Story

Find events in your community! Anyone who joins as a volunteer or committee member helps in the fight against cancer, and participates in forming teams and raising money. Get together with you team to discuss fundraising ideas and save lives.
